SEARCH
Package cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models

Interface IGameBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbsGameBoard, GameBoard, GameBoardMem
public interface IGameBoard
GameBoard representing a 2-dimensional ConnectX board with characters. Indexing starts at 0 (the bottom-left of the board).

Initialization Ensures: GameBoard contains only ' ' characters

Defines: NUMBER_OF_ROWS: Z NUMBER_OF_COLUMNS: Z NUMBER_TO_WIN: Z TOKENS_WHEN_FULL: NUMBER_OF_ROWS * NUMBER_OF_COLUMNS tokens_in_board: Z

Constraints: MIN_NUM_ROWS_AND_COLS_AND_NUM_TO_WIN invalid input: '<'= NUMBER_OF_ROWS invalid input: '<'= MAX_NUM_ROWS_AND_COLS MIN_NUM_ROWS_AND_COLS_AND_NUM_TO_WIN invalid input: '<'= NUMBER_OF_COLUMNS invalid input: '<'= MAX_NUM_ROWS_AND_COLS MIN_NUM_ROWS_AND_COLS_AND_NUM_TO_WIN invalid input: '<'= NUMBER_TO_WIN invalid input: '<'= MAX_NUM_TO_WIN 0 invalid input: '<'= tokens_in_board invalid input: '<'= TOKENS_WHEN_FULL [Columns of self cannot have any blank spaces below a non-blank token] [Columns of self cannot have any non-blank tokens above a blank space]

  • Method Details

    • getNumRows

      int getNumRows()
      Function returns number of rows in board
      Returns:
      int representing number of rows in the board

    • getNumColumns

      int getNumColumns()
      Function returns the number of columns in board
      Returns:
      int representing number of columns in the board

    • getNumToWin

      int getNumToWin()
      Function returns the number of tokens in a row a player needs to achieve to win
      Returns:
      int representing the number of consecutive tokens needed to win

    • whatsAtPos

      char whatsAtPos(BoardPosition pos)
      Returns character in self at position pos.
      Parameters:
      pos - BoardPosition object containing particular row and column values
      Returns:
      character ' ', 'X', or 'O' to either represent a player or a blank space.

    • dropToken

      void dropToken(char p, int c)
      Updates self by having the token fall to the lowest available row in column c.
      Parameters:
      p - char containing either 'X' or 'O' to represent player
      c - number representing selected column as an int

    • checkIfFree

      default boolean checkIfFree(int c)
      Returns boolean representing whether there is space remaining in the column
      Returns:
      true if column is not full, false otherwise.

    • checkForWin

      default boolean checkForWin(int c)
      Returns boolean representing whether the last move in column c has resulted in a win
      Parameters:
      c - number representing column that token was placed in.
      Returns:
      true if win has occurred, false otherwise

    • checkTie

      default boolean checkTie()
      Returns boolean representing whether the board is completely full after checking for empty cells on top row.
      Returns:
      false if at least one free space remains and true if none remain

    • checkHorizWin

      default boolean checkHorizWin(BoardPosition pos, char p)
      Determines if last move by player has resulted in at least NUMBER_TO_WIN tokens in a row horizontally. Returns boolean representing whether win has occurred horizontally.
      Parameters:
      pos - BoardPosition object containing row and column position of last token dropped by player p
      p - character representing current player (either 'X', or 'O')
      Returns:
      true if win has occurred by having at least NUMBER_TO_WIN tokens in a row horizontally, otherwise false

    • checkVertWin

      default boolean checkVertWin(BoardPosition pos, char p)
      Determines if last move by player has resulted in at least NUMBER_TO_WIN tokens in a row vertically. Returns boolean representing whether win has occurred vertically.
      Parameters:
      pos - BoardPosition object containing row and column position of last token dropped by player p
      p - character representing current player (either 'X', or 'O')
      Returns:
      true if win has occurred by having at least NUMBER_TO_WIN tokens in a row vertically, otherwise false

    • checkDiagWin

      default boolean checkDiagWin(BoardPosition pos, char p)
      Determines if last move by player has resulted in at least NUMBER_TO_WIN tokens in a row diagonally. Returns boolean representing whether win has occurred diagonally.
      Parameters:
      pos - BoardPosition object containing row and column position of last token dropped by player p
      p - character representing current player (either 'X', or 'O')
      Returns:
      true if win has occurred by having at least NUMBER_TO_WIN tokens in a row diagonally, otherwise false

    • isPlayerAtPos

      default boolean isPlayerAtPos(BoardPosition pos, char player)
      Returns a boolean representing whether specified player has a token in the specified position
      Parameters:
      pos - is the position being checked for a piece of a specified player
      player - is the character 'X' or 'O' that represents the player being checked for
      Returns:
      true if the specified player is in the position, and false if the player is not
